questions.question: At the beginning of Act 2, how many women sit in jail for witchcraft?
What lie does John tell to his wife about Abigail that comes to light in Act 2?

choices.answer: He said he was in a crowd with her, but they were actually alone together
He said they never had an affair
He said he never went to Salem

questions.question: Where does Elizabeth want John to go and what does she want him to do there?

choices.answer: She wants him to go into Salem and tell the authorities the girls are lying
She wants him to go to Salem and apologize to Abigail
She wants him to go help Parris with Betty
She wants him to conjure with Tituba

questions.question: What things are "suspicious" about Proctor and his family?

choices.answer: Proctor does not go to church regularly
The youngest son has not been baptized
He could not remember all of the commandments

questions.question: Why does Elizabeth think Abigail wants to kill her?

choices.answer: She believes that Abigail wants to take her place as John’s wife
Elizabeth is sick and a little paranoid
She believes Abigail is bewitched and will try to destroy anything good

questions.question: On what charge(s) was Rebecca Nurse arrested?

choices.answer: inability to say the Ten Commandments from memory

questions.question: Why does Cheever Come to the Proctor house?

choices.answer: He comes to talk with John about what to do about Parris.
He comes to ask John’s opinion about whether the girls are lying.

questions.question: What is the deciding factor in Elizabeth’s arrest?

choices.answer: Her inability to recite the Ten Commandments.
Her possession of the doll with a needle in it.
The fact that she has not had her son baptized.

questions.question: How would you describe Mary Warren during Act II
What commandment does John fail to mention?

choices.answer: Thou shalt have no other gods before me

questions.question: Mary Warren was aware of Abigail's plan to use the doll to frame Elizabeth Proctor.
In Act II, we come to realize that Reverend Hale has his doubts about witchcraft in Salem.
Mary Warren replaced Abigail as servant for the Proctors
Mary Warren agrees to testify against Abigail in court.
By the end of Act II, which of the following have been arrested for witchcraft?

choices.answer: Tituba, Rebecca Nurse, Abigail, Sarah Good
Rebecca Nurse, Goody Proctor, Martha Corey
John Proctor, Elizabeth Proctor, Giles Corey, Goody Putnam
